db:abstract.db:para: Provides C++ classes for Geocoding and Navigation.

db:article.db:para: Maps and Navigation provides C++ utilities for geocoding (finding a geographic coordinate from a street address) and navigation (including driving and walking directions).
Currently it is not possible to interact with maps via C++. Mapping applications must use the Maps and Navigation (QML) API.

db:section.db:title: Geocoding
db:section.db:para: In C++, an address-to-coordinate query is performed using the geocode() method of the QGeoCodingManager class. For coordinate-to-address queries, the reverseGeocode() method is available on the same class. Instances of QGeoCodingManager are available via QGeoServiceProvider.

db:td.db:para: Provides a QGeoCodingManager instance ready for use.
Accepts queries and produces QGeoCodeReply objects.
Contains the results of a geocoding query.

db:section.db:title: Navigation
db:section.db:para: In C++, a route query is performed using the calculate() method of the QGeoRoutingManager class. The returned route reply can contain multiple routes to the same destination.

db:td.db:para: Provides a QGeoCodingManager instance ready for use.
Accepts queries and produces QGeoRouteReply objects.
Contains the results of a routing query.
